description: Returns the versioning state of a bucket.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.technique: T1530 - Data from Cloud Storage Object
unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Understanding the versioning and MFA Delete status allows attackers to potentially collect older or deleted versions of data, which might not be available in a non-versioned setup.

Attackers with valid accounts (e.g., those who have compromised credentials) may use this API call to gather information that could further their goals, such as determining the best method to evade detection or exfiltrate data.

The versioning status of a bucket might indicate the presence of multiple versions of stored data, which attackers could access and collect as part of their broader objective of gathering information from cloud storage.

incidents.description: Muddled Libra’s Evolution to the Cloud
Leaked Environment Variables Allow Large-Scale Extortion Operation in Cloud Environments

securityImplications: Attackers might use GetBucketVersioning to identify unsecured S3 buckets with versioning disabled, making it easier to manipulate or delete data.
